column4: I have a problem trying to upgrade my sources.list, the message said.. : W: Coulnd't stat sorce package list http://package.freecontrb.org breezy/free Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/ packages.freecontrb.org_ubuntu_plf_dists_breezy_free_binary-i386_Packages) - stat (2 no such file or directory)  what should I do?
comment that line out
can you say "non-offical repo"
I mean it can give you a whole slew of trouble
their server may be down, may have changed, the file may be removed
you should check out "easyubuntu", it uses the plf repos, but is much safer
oh, is that what's causing the error?
sure, you can even see what's going on in #easyubuntu
if you use easyubuntu, then I'd say you would no longer really need the plf line in your source.list
that's why having unoffical repos can break systems
if you don't mind me asking, what's the program you want
ok, comment out that line and sudo apt-get update
you don't have any other unoffical repos in there do you?
like debian ones
you can paste your sources.list on pastebin and I'll have a look
check your pm
here u go..  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9964
yeah, comment out the wine/opera lines, leave soulmachine commented

the thing about "non-offical repos" is, they're ok if you trust them but only have them active when you are getting software that is strickly from those, then when you get the stuff, comment them out again, don't leave them active and you should be good to go
what you have is ok, stick with that and you'll be fine
just make sure you leave all unoffical repos commented untill you need them
brb
type "/join #easyubuntu" for all you questions
